item.title: Reproducibility Hackathon Netherlands – the aftermath
item.description:
On Saturday 30 November, 44 excited researchers gathered at the Leiden University Library to join the very first ReproHack – short for Reproducibility Hackathon – in the Netherlands. In a nutshell, a ReproHack is aimed at assessing the reproducibility of scientific research that publicly shared code and data. During a ReproHack, participants get to work with other people’s material in a low pressure environment and record their experiences on a number of key aspects, including reproducibility, transparency and reusability of materials.

We share our experience of organizing this event in the post we wrote for the Software Sustainability Institute.

If you are excited to become part of the ReproHack community check our website (under construction!) to see if there is an event nearby or to share a paper for a future ReproHack. You can also follow us on Twitter!

item.title: Vacation <- grow(RLadiesNetwork)
item.description:
While I was living in Buenos Aires, Argentina I had the opportunity to meet two kind, strong and super smart women: Mine Dogucu and Laura Ación. They did not only encouraged me to pursuit a PhD, but it is thanks to them that Rladies Buenos Aires was born.

In the post we wrote together for the R-Ladies Global blog we tell you all the details about how couch surfing led to the expansion of the R-Ladies Network in Latin America.
